intro: Pseudolysimachion spicatum subsp. bashkiriense, commonly known as Bashkir spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
